based on the requirement on Confluence page: for users who do not have permission to approve/reject learning outcome, they do not have a tab called "pending", the pending tab is for org admin, so I am not sure about this one here.
column15:
Yes, you are right: my pending (org admin) = "waiting for approval" (normal user) 
- If the user is a normal user, then the permission of "view my pending learning outcome" 
is not applicable to them; "waiting for approval" is applicable. However, "waiting for approval" is included in "unpublished learning outcome" for normal user, do you intend to separate the permission of "waiting for approval" from "unpublished learning outcome"?
- If the user is an org admin who should have approval permission, then only permission_413 is applicable, because for org admin, my pending learning outcome is the same as org pending learning outcome. 
To summarize, it seems the only possible explaination for this permission is: This permission is applicable for normal user, and should named as "View my waiting for approval learning outcome", then four scenarios:
1. select permission_410 and select permission_412, user could see all his/her unpublished learning outcome, including the "waiting for approval" one.
2. select permission_410, unselect permission_412, user should only see "draft" and "rejected" learning outcome.
3. unselect permission_410, select permission_412, user should only see "waiting for approval" learning outcome.
4. unselect permission_410, unselect permission_412, user won't see any unpublished learning outcoem when click the unpublished link.

Could you please confirm about this one?
